Class Hand

java.lang.Object
Uno.Hand
public class Hand extends Object
The Hand class represents a collection of cards a player holds in a card game. It includes methods for managing the hand, such as adding or removing cards, determining playable cards, and calculating hand-specific statistics.

  • Constructor Details

    • Hand

      public Hand()
      Constructs a new Hand object and initializes it with a default set of cards. This constructor populates the hand with seven cards drawn from the game's draw pile. Each card is drawn from the top of the draw pile using the `getTopCard` method, which optionally removes the card from the deck after retrieval.

    • Hand

      public Hand(int numStartingCards)
      Constructs a new Hand object with a specified number of starting cards. This constructor populates the hand by drawing the specified number of cards from the game's draw pile. Each card is drawn from the top of the draw pile using the `getTopCard` method, which optionally removes the card from the deck after retrieval.
      Parameters:
      numStartingCards - the number of cards to draw from the draw pile to initialize the hand

  • Method Details

    • getHand

      public List<Card> getHand()
      Retrieves the list of cards currently in the hand.
      Returns:
      a list containing the cards in the hand.

    • numCardsInHand

      public int numCardsInHand()
      Retrieves the total number of cards currently in the hand.
      Returns:
      the number of cards in the hand.

    • getCardFromHand

      public Card getCardFromHand(int index, boolean removeAfterGet)
      Retrieves a card from the hand at the specified index. If the removeAfterGet parameter is true, the card will also be removed from the hand.
      Parameters:
      index - the position of the card to retrieve from the hand
      removeAfterGet - a boolean flag indicating whether the card should be removed from the hand after retrieval
      Returns:
      the card at the specified index
      Throws:
      Error - if the hand is empty when trying to retrieve a card

    • getColorThatTheMostCardsUse

      public Card.Colors getColorThatTheMostCardsUse()
      Determines the color that is most frequently used by the cards in the hand. Wild cards (cards with a number greater than or equal to 13) are ignored when counting.
      Returns:
      the color that is used by the highest number of cards in the hand

    • addCard

      public void addCard(Card newCard)
      Adds a new card to the current hand.
      Parameters:
      newCard - the card to be added to the hand

    • getPlayableCards

      public List<Integer> getPlayableCards()
      Retrieves a list of indices representing the cards in the hand that can be played on the current top card of the discard pile. A card is considered playable if it shares the same number or color as the top card, or if it is a wild card (e.g., card number >= 13).
      Returns:
      a list of integers, where each integer represents the index of a playable card in the hand. The list is empty if no cards are playable.

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Generates a string representation of the hand, indicating which cards can be played and the available actions. Playable cards are marked with their index (starting from 1), and unplayable cards are marked with a placeholder. If no cards are playable, an option to draw a card from the draw pile is added.
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      a string representing the current state of the hand, including playable and unplayable cards along with possible actions.
